they could make this game $60 and I'd still be ripping them off

I never played portal before, because i prefer multiplayer games, but honestly,  it was considerably one of the best games i ever played(i am comparing portal to witcher 3 and other triple A games). Puzzles are creative and always made with new methods to solve them, so you won't ever encounter same level twice, therefore game is not redudant. Difficulty is balanced, altough last levels are mostly about timing(hand-eye coordination) than problem-solving, and of course, lore, robots humour and all the dialogue is really funny imho, 10/10,  only minus i would consider is probably lack of dlc/new chapters. It took me 10 hours and i would gladly delete my memmory and play it again. Immersion is great and you can see that devs enjoyed programming this game a lot, because there is a  lot of details in each chapter of the game.  I hope they will make another portal game, or atleast similar to this one, because it's just perfect.
THe best and diferent game ever

In this game you will discover:
    that you are not in an IKEA store but there is not a real difference
    that painting walls is actually enjoyable
    that calculate the momentum through the portal is not like science but more likely mastering an art
    in the past, your boss would have behaved the same as today but dressed better
    in the future, your boss will behave the same as today, but at least he will be a robot
    the most amazing tech in the world ... living in a potato
This is my new favorite game ever. It is a pretty long game, it has a lot to it.
